markdownRemark.html:
Score: 100

dailynews.com  (WEB - en-US)

The website of the Los Angeles Daily News, a century-old daily newspaper covering Los Angeles and the surrounding San Fernando Valley.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

The Los Angeles Daily News is part of the Southern California News Group, a collection of 11 newspapers owned by Digital First Media. Digital First Media is a private company that owns nearly 100 newspapers in the U.S., including the Denver Post. Digital First generates revenue from subscriptions and advertising on its printed publications and digital products. It also operates AdTaxi, a programmatic advertising product for businesses.

Digital First Media is owned by Alden Global Capital LLC, a New York-based hedge fund that has been the subject of controversy for substantial staff cuts at Digital First Media properties. In 2018, staff at The Denver Post and the Bay Area News Group engaged in a series of public protests and editorials against Alden’s ownership, with The Denver Post publicly describing its owners as “vulture capitalists.”

Dailynews.com’s revenue comes from advertisements and an online paywall.

Content

Much of dailynews.com’s content is local interest reporting centered on the San Fernando Valley. The website features a prominent “Things To Do” section, an opinion page, and a section listing investigative reporting done by other papers in the Southern California News Group. The site sometimes features California-focused stories reported in other outlets, including other Southern California News Group papers. National and international news is provided by wire services, including The Associated Press.

Credibility

News stories are all either reported firsthand by Daily News reporters or comefrom attributed, reliable sources. Most images are taken by Daily News staff or attributed to their sources. The outlet’s opinion writing is kept on the opinion page. The Daily News staff has a corrections page listing articles that have been updated, and make it clear how corrections can be suggested.

Transparency

The Daily News staff is listed alongside contact details on the site’s Contact Us page. Article bylines include contact information and link to the writer’s biography. Advertisements are clearly labeled and the website clearly indicates its ownership.

History

The newspaper was founded in 1911 as the Van Nuys Call. From the 1940s until the 1980s. the paper was printed in green ink to differentiate it from its competitors. It changed its name to the Los Angeles Daily News in 1981 and was acquired by Digital First Media (then MediaNews Group) in 1998.

Written by:
Bron Maher

Edited by:
Anna-Sophie Harling Amy Westfeldt
